Detailed Description

MiscAudioDevice
Class Miscellaneous audio functions.

Note: Do not use audio interface given by the *AudioDevices* header files as they are outdated and will be removed.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum MiscAudioDevice::Accessory
 

Available accessory.

Enumerator:
AccessoryNormal  Normal.
AccessoryHeadset  Headset.
AccessoryStereoPhones  Stereo phones.
AccessoryBtHeadset  Headset.
AccessoryCarKit  Car kit.

Member Function Documentation

void MiscAudioDevice::CheckTime (   )  [static]
 

In order for the audio driver to work properly this function must be called from GSM layer 1 upon all frame interrupts.

static AvailableHW MiscAudioDevice::GetAvailableHW (   )  [static]
 

Returns which resources there are available.

Returns:
structure of available hardware of all devices.

See also:
AbstractDevice::GetName

Implements AbstractDevice.

static PowerStatus MiscAudioDevice::GetPowerStatus (   )  [static]
 

Returns status about which audio HW is currently powered on. In the return parameter there is a bit for each HW block control by the audio driver.

Returns:
structure of power status of all devices.

void MiscAudioDevice::RestartHf (   )  [static]
 

Whenever GSM layer 1 gives TCH26 command to the DSP, layer 1 must also call this audio function. This is because the TCH26 command resets some of the audio algorithm (echo canceller, voice memo etc.) running on the DSP, and the audio has restart these algorithms.

void MiscAudioDevice::SetAccessory (  Accessory  accessory  )  [static]
 

Instructs the audio driver to setup the audio to use an inserted accessory, e.g. a headset.
When the accessory is removed, this function must be called again to instruct the audio driver to use the normal audio path.

Parameters:
accessory Accessory to set.

void MiscAudioDevice::SetVmic (  UINT8  status  )  [static]
 

Powers the microphone voltage on. This is used in some accessory detection concepts.

Parameters:
status
